messages: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:03): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: unable to properly pong right now, gotta run. sorry.
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (18:05): when you come back: i was wondering what your ideas are more specifically with cdata sections and the content model flag in svg scope

73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (18:08): on one hand, it's nice to have the same content model flag changes as legacy UAs, but that creates a problem with <textArea>. otoh, it's nice to have the same content model as in svg-in-xml, but that means we probably have to introduce cdata sections
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (18:10): authors are used to doing "<script>//<![CDATA[" when working with both html and xhtml
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (18:16): also, using /> syntax on elements that are (r)cdata in legacy UAs will mess up in legacy UAs
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:17): I don't think keeping the syntax indentical is realistic
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (18:17): to the same extent as between html and xhtml is realistic
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:18): that isn't either
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (18:19): um, now i don't follow
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:20): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: to be honest, I didn't think CDATA sections and legacy behavior of <script> and <style> through properly
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:21): well, HTML has (R)CDATA elements, XHTML has namespace prefixes, etc.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:21): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: it would be good to raise the issues you see on list
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:21): I mean, XHTML has namespaces
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (18:22): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: ah. right. i mean that it's possible to have a document that parses into roughly the same thing for both cases

73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (18:23): and, to the same extent as that is possible with html and xhtml, it is realistic to design the svg-in-text/html such that it would be possible with svg in html as well
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (18:23): it seems possible with b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9's proposal, e.g.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:25): I think I'd do it in a way that you switch to something called the "SVG phase" in the parser
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:25): and you go back to the "in body phase" (currently called body insertion mode iirc) the moment you hit <foreignobject>
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:25): you switch to "SVG phase" when you hit <svg>
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (18:26): yep, makes sense
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:26): that would allow for <svg:script> to have different parsing rules even, if desirable
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:26): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: yeah.
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (18:27): but is it?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:27): no
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:27): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: I thought 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 was asking about <script> doing weird stuff in legacy browsers
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:27): but it is for <textarea> within <svg>
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:27): apparently
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:27): does SVG have its own textarea?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (18:27): textArea, yes
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (18:28): it can contain elements
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:28): I didn't remember that
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:28): SVG 1.2
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:28): ah, never had even made it on my radar to be forgotten, then
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (18:29): it's a shape that contains text, aiui
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:29): oh right, they have something else for editing
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:30): grmbls
